@vrv I finally got the time to go over this once again.

bazel run //:configure -- --tf_workspace=$(PWD) --workspace=$(PWD)

This will write the bazelrc inside the current workspace.
I haven't find a way to pass the full workspace path to the bazel rule other than explicitly settting them. We might change ./configure to run bazel with those parameters.

The nice thing is now importing tensorflow from another module works. See this bareminimum workspace: https://github.com/Mistobaan/sample_tf_bazel_import

body:
@vrv I finally got the time to go over this once again.

```bash
bazel run //:configure -- --tf_workspace=$(PWD) --workspace=$(PWD)
```
This will write the bazelrc inside the current workspace. 
I haven't find a way to pass the full workspace path to the bazel rule other than explicitly settting them. We might change ./configure to run `bazel` with those parameters.

The nice thing is now importing tensorflow from another module works. See this bareminimum workspace: https://github.com/Mistobaan/sample_tf_bazel_import
